Thanks! I'll start with an isort PR & autopep8 PRs and then we can do per-directory for the other changes. I agree that a long running branch is not a good solution, since this involves a large number of small changes to pretty much everything it probably only takes about a day for it to become unmergeable.

@peihe this will probably work, since the breaking changes in API in Spark 2.x are small.
However, our plan currently is to support both Spark 1.6.x and Spark 2.x in the runner.
This is covered by [BEAM-1920](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1920)
I believe this is currently being worked on by @jbonofre you two can sync your efforts on this.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/13045955/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/13045955)

retest this please

There are both issues where our use of inheritance is broken and also a couple outstanding dependencies that are trouble. Beyond that, there's the bloat problem which is looking like it might be a real problem nowadays, whereas before it was premature optimization to worry about.
I replied on the mailing list about that. Indeed, I have a branch with a new Spark 2 runner. @peihe can you please sync before pushing any PR ? Thanks !
R: @jbonofre
